meta.hint: Some adjectives compare people, animals, places or things. Comparative adjectives compare two people, animals, places or things.  They end in -er. eg. Andy is taller than his sister.         eg. A boy and a girl are standing. The girl comes up to the boy's shoulder.  Superlative adjectives compare more than two people, animals, places, or things. They end in -est. eg. He is the tallest person in his class.

content.description: She is funniest in the class.
